response.overview: A music documentary (49 minutes) produced by the BBC in 1996.  Focuses on LTJ Bukem and his label Good Looking Records, particularly as they begin to expand internationally — notably looking at their first Sony deal in Japan and LTJ Bukem breaking into the USA. internationally — notably looking at their first Sony deal in Japan and LTJ Bukem breaking into the USA. Behind-the-scenes of the music industry: the mechanics of growing an independent label. The pressures, the logistics, the negotiations. Touring life: LTJ Bukem, MC Conrad, Blame, and the Good Looking team on tour. The contrast between the glamour of DJ fame and practical challenges. The cultural side: how the drum & bass / jungle scene saw “intelligent” or melodic d’n’b as opposed to harder, faster styles. Interactions with fans/ravers and how people responded to Bukem’s sound.
response.title: Modern Times - LTJ Bukem Documentary
